A Guide to Building Your Own Hexo Blog For Free
entry.content:
Preface

Along with the rapid development of internet, more and more social media platforms grew popularity around the globe, allowing the flow of information to be more efficient than ever. These platforms are easy to use in all aspects. However, we have that geek spirit. To be honest with yourself, have you never dreamed of owning a website of your own? A place where you can share what you care about and what you care about only. Technology, lifestyle, science, art; and the list of topic goes on. Let’s do this together, learning this whole blog thing from 0 to 1 (wink).

What is Hexo?

Hexo is a static blog framework based on Node.js that uses very little dependencies and installation. Hexo can help you generate static webpages to be hosted on GitHub and Heroku easily. In this tutorial, we will be using GitHub Pages as our free hosting service. Hexo is also an open-source project on GitHub, which you can learn more here. For more detail please visit their official website.

还有要说的一点就是Hexo的创始人是台湾人，因此Hexo对中文的支持非常友好。 文档也都有中文版.

Outline

  1. Get a personal domain (optional)
  2. Create new a respiratory on GitHub
  3. Install Git
  4. Install Nodes.js
  5. Install Hexo
  6. Publish website
  7. Use your custom domain (optional)
  8. Change to your preferred theme
  9. Basic MarkDown syntax
  10. Publish your first article
  11. Find an image hosting service
  12. Personalization

Purchasing Domain (Optional)

A personal domain, although not necessary, is the first impression your visitors will have of you. There are a varies kind of top level domain you can choose from(e.g., .com, .ca, .net, .xym, .me). Some of the best domain sites I have worked with are namesilo.com, namecheap, and name.com.
I suggest you to apply for a GitHub Student Developer Pack, it gives you the ability to use a free domain of your choice for the duration of a year. Here is a link to

If you feel like this is something you would want, just go ahead to your preferred site and purchase the domain of your choice, set it aside, and we will use it later in this tutorial.
